intro: Populus dimorpha, commonly known as the two-form poplar, is a species of poplar native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its distinct morphological variations, with some individuals exhibiting different leaf shapes and growth forms depending on environmental conditions. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cooler, moist climates. Its leaves are usually broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture and a serrated margin. Populus dimorpha plays a significant role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native range.
